oai_dc:dc.dc:title: Robert R. Church, Jr. and Congressman Oscar DePriest
oai_dc:dc.dc:subject: Achieving Recognition
National Leaders
African American businesspeople; African American politicians
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: Two men standing in front of a plate glass window, 392 Beale Avenue.

Robert Reed Church, Jr. was politically active both locally and with the National Republican Party. Here he stands in front of his office on Beale, alongside Oscar DePriest, one of the first United States congressmen to be elected after Reconstruction.
